abstract: Lydia Ko, world No 1 women's golfer who turns 18 on April 24, is in California preparing for ANA Inspiration golf tournament; hopes to become youngest golfer with most major wins in LPGA Tour history.
lead_paragraph: Ko enters the women’s first major with a string of 28 consecutive competitive rounds under par, and she aims to become the youngest major winner in L.P.G.A. Tour history.

headline.main: As Lydia Ko Turns 18, She Hopes to Celebrate With a Major Title
headline.print_headline: Turning 18, and Hoping to Celebrate a Major Title

snippet: Ko enters the women’s first major with a string of 28 consecutive competitive rounds under par, and she aims to become the youngest major winner in L.P.G.A. Tour history.
